intro: Katherinea carrii, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Katherinea carrii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
